strokeWidth(float).Description: Sets the stroke width. The stroke width is the width (in screen pixels) of the circle's outline. It must be zero or greater. If it is zero then no outline is drawn. The default width is 10 pixels.

Parameters: false to make this circle invisible
visible(boolean).Description: Sets the visibility. If this circle is not visible then it is not drawn, but all other state is preserved.

Returns: True if the circle is visible; false if it is invisible.
isVisible().Description: Checks whether the circle is visible.

zIndex(float).Description: Sets the zIndex. Overlays (such as circles) with higher zIndices are drawn above those with lower indices. By default the zIndex is 0.0.

strokeColor(int).Description: Sets the stroke color. The stroke color is the color of this circle's outline, in the integer format specified by @B_android#graphics#Color_E@. If TRANSPARENT is used then no outline is drawn. By default the stroke color is black (0xff000000).

fillColor(int).Description: Sets the fill color. The fill color is the color inside the circle, in the integer format specified by @B_android#graphics#Color_E@. If TRANSPARENT is used then no fill is drawn. By default the fill color is transparent (0x00000000).

radius(double).Description: Sets the radius in meters. The radius must be zero or greater. The default radius is zero.

getRadius().Description: Returns the circle's radius, in meters.

center(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.Description: Sets the center using a @B_com#google#android#gms#maps#model#LatLng_E@. The center must not be null. This method is mandatory because there is no default center.
